sources.title: Uncle was a Vampire (1959) HORROR-COMEDY
sources.description:
Stars: Renato Rascel, Sylva Koscina, Christopher Lee
 Director: Steno

 Baron Osvaldo Lambertenghi is forced to sell his ancestral castle; when it's converted into a hotel, he stays on as a bellboy. His mysterious uncle arrives--and turns out to be a vampire. When his uncle vampirizes Osvaldo, the newly-minted blood-sucker gallops about the castle sipping from the necks of dozens of beautiful female guests. Christopher Lee successfully revives his most famous role with a well timed comic twist.

metadata.Plot: Baron Osvaldo Lambertenghi is forced to sell his ancestral castle; when it's converted into a hotel, he stays on as a bellboy. His mysterious uncle arrives and turns out to be a vampire. When his uncle vampirizes Osvaldo, the newly-minted blood-sucker gallops about the castle sipping from the necks of dozens of beautiful female guests.
metadata.Writer: Edoardo Anton, Mario Cecchi Gori, Marcello Fondato
metadata.Actors: Renato Rascel, Sylva Koscina, Lia Zoppelli
